page.title: 16Beckenham Place Park
page.content: Beckenham Place was one of the private homes of the Cator family. It was built in the eighteenth century on a site where a Tudor farm may once have stood. Peter Cator, who was the last of the family to live, there died in 1873.He built many of the roads of the Cator Estate in Beckenham eg The Knoll. Dr. Samuel Johnson planted trees in the garden, and Coleridge is supposed to have written "the Ancient Mariner" under a magnificent tulip tree there. It became a school in 1893 and one of its early pupils was one of the first women to enter Oxford University. A local girls' comprehensive school, Cator Park, is named after the family. This school, which was then known as Balgowan Senior School, was used as a hospital during both World Wars.
